hero.title: About Sumud
hero.subtitle: Finnish Palestine Network
hero.description: We are a community-driven organization dedicated to promoting solidarity, education, and advocacy for Palestinian rights in Finland.

mission.title: Our Mission
mission.description: Sumud (صمود) means "steadfast perseverance" in Arabic. We embody this spirit by fostering understanding, providing education, and advocating for Palestinian rights within Finnish society. Through cultural exchange, community building, and peaceful activism, we work to create a more just and informed world.

whatWeDo.title: What We Do
whatWeDo.subtitle: Our work spans education, advocacy, cultural exchange, and community support to advance Palestinian rights and solidarity.

education.title: Education & Awareness
education.description: Providing accurate information about Palestinian history, culture, and current events through workshops, seminars, and public events.

advocacy.title: Advocacy & Campaigns
advocacy.description: Supporting BDS initiatives, apartheid-free zones, and cultural/academic boycotts to promote Palestinian rights.

cultural.title: Cultural Exchange
cultural.description: Celebrating Palestinian heritage and fostering connections between Finnish and Palestinian communities.

community.title: Community Support
community.description: Organizing fundraising events and humanitarian initiatives to support Palestinian communities.

values.title: Our Values
values.subtitle: These core principles guide everything we do in our work for Palestinian solidarity.

solidarity.title: Solidarity
solidarity.description: Building bridges of understanding and support between Finnish and Palestinian communities.

justice.title: Justice
justice.description: Advocating for human rights and dignity for all Palestinian people.

community.title: Community
community.description: Creating inclusive spaces for dialogue, education, and collective action.

engage.title: Ways to Engage
engage.subtitle: There are many ways to support our mission and become part of the Sumud community.
